name: LoginDataBaseSystem

introduction: Each user has a number of attempts

name: PasswordChangeSystem
options: Passwords are changed periodically, so it is rare that more than one person knows a password that is not theirs.
The password change is up to the user. Then, there are workers who change it every day, and others who have never changed it and then everyone knows their password.
Passwords are never changed, which has caused all employees to know practically everyone's passwords.

name: UserAccounts
options: There are no users and everyone can directly access any computer.
Users are limited and are not authorized to perform all available actions as there are different user profiles.

name: UserProfiles
options: One of the existing profiles is that of the manager of the company being managed, this profile is the only one that can modify and close the payroll of that company.

One of the existing profiles is that of the manager of the company being managed, this profile can modify and close the payroll of that company, but there are two other users who can modify and close the payroll for when the manager is not there. It could happen that none of the 3 are there.

One of the existing profiles is that of the manager of the company being managed, this profile can do everything, but also any worker can modify the payroll of that company, although it is known who does what action always by the use of a log.

One of the existing profiles is that of the manager of the company being managed, this profile can do everything, but also any worker also has all possible permissions, although it is known who does what action always by the use of a log

One of the existing profiles is that of the manager of the company being managed, this profile can do everything, but also any worker also has all possible permissions, without leaving a trace of who did what, as there is no log.
However, it is poorly managed and any worker has all possible permissions, but it is known who does what action always by the use of a log.
However, it is poorly managed and any worker has all possible permissions. In addition, they can do everything without leaving a trace of who did what, as there is no log system.
However, there is only one administrator account, which is the manager of the company, and it is shared by all users, as they do not have their own accounts.
